intro: Corunastylis mollissima, commonly known as the silky bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its soft, velvety foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
